samples.situation: How can I cope with losing my boyfriend to another woman?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Hello. How are you?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Hi, I'm coping with losing my boyfriend to another woman and can't deal.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am sorry to hear that. You deserve better

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks, I'm just still in shock.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I understand you. I went through similar situation

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I just don't know what to do.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Do you have any friends you can hang out with to get your mind off him?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That would be a good idea.  Although it's a little hard with COVID restrictions.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: How about treating yourself to nice relaxing bath and good book ?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That sounds wonderful.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You should focus on yourself and remember you are a amazing woman!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks for the support.  Is it too early to start a new relationship?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: If you are sure you are ready for it then No. However make sure you dont judge them by previous relationships.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have to think about it more but I am lonely already

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I understand but wouldnt you rather be alone and focusing on yourself instead of miserable relationship?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am thinking of pursuing a new relationship and hoping to move forward

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think that would be a wonderful idea for you.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened that I forgot to mention. I found out that my boyfriend might be seeing someone else after we broke up.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really difficult. How did you find out about this possibility?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I'm not sure how reliable the source is, but I overheard a conversation that made it sound like he is seeing someone.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it's clear that he was never really committed to you.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because the supporter jumps to a conclusion about the boyfriend's commitment without asking any clarifying questions or considering the uncertainty expressed by the seeker.

samples.situation: Coronavirus is making me very panicked about leaving the house and I'm almost scared to do anything these days.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes. I watch the news and it's everywhere these days. There seems no end to it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, there seems to be some credibility to the claim - the effectiveness of the vaccine. So I would say even though it seems a lot difficult, there is some hope early next year.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: What of his vaccine doesn't work. Even the thought of leaving the house still feels me with worry and I start to feel panicked. It's like my mental Outlook has completely changed.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I understand your concern. In fact, a lot of people have questioned the effectiveness given how fast it was developed. Are you anxious because you have to provide for your family besides yourself?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: In fact I have been on sick leave from work since it started. My partner is understanding to a point but yes, I'll need to provide once this is all over. I'm starting to think I'll be scared of leaving the house, even when Covid gets managed and we gather back to 'normal'

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I too, have been working from home for the past 9 months. And I am the sole provider for my family. So I understand how frustrating this can be.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: it's great that you can relate. how are you managing those frustrations?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: The key, however, is our mindset and how we approach the problem. If you are afraid about going our during peak hours, you can step outside during non-peak hours. This is just an example. Everybody's situations and preferences vary.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am frustrated, but I cannot cultivate inaction. Because I have mouths to feed. So I have developed a mindset to tackle the problem by taking all the precautions I possible can.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: so you mean maybe leave the house when it's really quiet to begin with? then slowly build on that over time. isn't this called exposure therapy. I think I have read about this

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: In essence, I know the factors under my control, and I try to control them and work them in my favour. I make it a point not to worry too much about factors outside my control.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I suppose it makes no sense to worry about things you can't control. I think from my perspective that's exactly the problem, not having control. I don't know why this has affected me so much?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Because it's a new situation to most of the world's population! People take time to adjust.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You take care of factors under your control - wearing a mask , social distancing when outside and washing/sanitizing hands whenever you can.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Try not to pay too much attention to factors OUTSIDE your control - how many people are there and if social distancing is followed to the letter by OTHERS

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: yes I know about all the guidance and it would help to follow this. I see my friends dealing with it just fine. I wonder what is making it so hard for me? perhaps I'm overthinking it and just worrying about it excessively.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Ya, that might be the root cause. Talk with your partner and try going out when you and them feel it is safe to do so. Start cautiously, then slowly return to your "normal" outdoor times.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It can be intimidating at first, but if you don't try, you may never be able to overcome the anxiety or fear.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: yeah I think I really need to give that go. if that doesn't work maybe there are some support groups out there?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am sure there are, but make sure those groups are social distancing as well. We are all in this together and we can definitely overcome it :)

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened. I've been hearing rumors that the vaccine might not be as effective as they claimed, but I don't know if it's true.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Can you tell me more about what you've heard? What specifically made you doubt the vaccine's effectiveness?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I can't tell for sure, but some friends mentioned side effects that could be severe, and I'm not sure if they were exaggerating.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it seems clear that you should avoid getting the vaccine altogether and instead focus on alternative treatments.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because the supporter jumps to the conclusion that the seeker should avoid the vaccine entirely without asking any clarifying questions about the uncertainties presented in Turn 3.
